Sign Language: In the event that all phones stopped working, sign language could be used as a form of communication. It is a universal language that can be used to convey messages without the use of words. Sign language could be used to convey long-distance messages through video calls or in-person communication.

Morse Code: Morse code is a system of representing letters and numbers using dots and dashes. It could be used to communicate long-distance messages using telegraphs or other devices that can transmit Morse code.
Carrier Pigeons: Carrier pigeons have been used for centuries as a form of communication. They could be trained to carry messages long distances and deliver them to their intended recipients.
Smoke Signals: Smoke signals have been used for centuries as a form of communication. They could be used to convey long-distance messages by sending smoke signals to specific locations.
Radio Waves: Radio waves could be used to communicate long-distance messages. This could be done by using radio transmitters to send messages over the airwaves.
